Sequence 2 - Drosophila

Match Number: 335
Gap Number: 1593
Mismatch Number: 927

With this Global Alignment Result using a Needleman-Wunsch algorithm that I implemented MMyself, 
we can see that considering the difference in the size of the sequences, the number of matches is
very significant, although a local alignment would probably yield even better results.
The result with NCBI algorithm was very different, but that was probably due to the different 
weight, for gaps, matches and mismatches

----- Exercise 2 -----
Using NCBI BLAST and the local alignment, two subsections with large similarity were found, the first 
with 73% similarity and the second with 71%

Blasting this significant sequence against all GenBank database, there were a lot of matches:

Otolemur Garnettii, Aotus Nancymaae, Callithrix Jacchus, Sus Scrofa, Capra Hircus, 
Propothecus Coquereli, Ornicus Orca, Ovis Aries, Camelus Dromedarius, Bison Bison, 
Bos Taurus, Pan Paniscus, Ursus Maritimus, Balaenoptera Acutorostrata, Bubalus Bubalis, 
Physeter Catodon, Vicugna Pacos, Camelus Ferus, Pantholops Hodgsonii, Bos Mutus, 
Orcinus Orca, Gorilla Gorilla, Mustela Putorius, Microcebus Murinus, Cercocebus Atys, 
Mandrillus Leucophaeus

Therefore, we can see that this sequence has much biological significance, as expected.
